00023 namespace gtl

00031     template<typename Type>
00032         class RectPrism : public Polyhedron<Type>
00033     {
00034     public:
00036         RectPrism()
00037         {
00038                         Vec3<Type> pts[8];
00039 
00040                         if (m_vertices != NULL)
00041                         {
00042                                 delete [] m_vertices;
00043                         }
00044                         m_vertices = NULL;
00045                         m_num_vertices = 0;
00046 
00047                         pts[0].setValue((Type)0.0, (Type)0.0, (Type)0.0);
00048                         pts[1].setValue((Type)1.0, (Type)0.0, (Type)0.0);
00049                         pts[2].setValue((Type)1.0, (Type)1.0, (Type)0.0);
00050                         pts[3].setValue((Type)0.0, (Type)1.0, (Type)0.0);
00051                         pts[4].setValue((Type)0.0, (Type)0.0, (Type)1.0);
00052                         pts[5].setValue((Type)1.0, (Type)0.0, (Type)1.0);
00053                         pts[6].setValue((Type)1.0, (Type)1.0, (Type)1.0);
00054                         pts[7].setValue((Type)0.0, (Type)1.0, (Type)1.0);
00055 
00056                         setVertices(pts);
00057 
00058                         m_fill_init = 0;
00059                         m_resolution = 1.0;
00060                         m_num_fill_points = 1;
00061                         
00062                         m_i_dim = 1.0;
00063                         m_j_dim = 1.0;
00064                         m_k_dim = 1.0;
00065 
00066                         m_ray_i = NULL;
00067                         m_ray_j = NULL;
00068                         m_ray_k = NULL;
00069         }
00070 
00072         RectPrism(Vec3<Type> *pts)
00073         {
00074                         m_vertices = NULL;
00075                         m_num_vertices = 0;
00076 
00077             if (setVertices(pts) < 0)
00078                                 RectPrism();    // if setVertices fails, construct default polyhedron...
00079         }
00080 
00081                 int setVertices(Vec3<Type> *pts)
00082                 {
00083                         return Polyhedron::setVertices(pts, 8);
00084                 }
00085 
00086                 int getNumFillPoints()
00087                 {
00088                         if (m_fill_init == 0)
00089                                 prepareFill(1.0);
00090 
00091                         return m_num_fill_points;
00092                 }
00093 
00094                 // this method must be called before calling any of the other fill methods
00095                 void prepareFill(double resolution)
00096                 {
00097                         // 1. Start with arbitrary point (m_vertices[0])
00098                         // 2. Find its 3 linearly independent link points (the 2 closest points are alway part of
00099                         // the list of 3 linearly independent connected points, and the 3rd one is obtained from
00100                         // the cross product of the 2 produced vectors)
00101                         Vec3<Type> link_points[3];
00102                         double min_dist[2];
00103                         Vec3<Type> link_vectors[3];
00104                         int min_index[2] = {0}; // index of the vertex that is the first closest one to vertex 0
00105 
00106                         for (int i = 0; i < 2; i++)
00107                         {
00108                                 min_dist[i] = DBL_MAX;
00109                                 for (int j = 1; j < 8; j++)
00110                                 {
00111                                         if (j != min_index[0])
00112                                         {
00113                                                 Vec3<Type> vec;
00114 
00115                                                 vec = m_vertices[j] - m_vertices[0];
00116 
00117                                                 if (vec.length() < min_dist[i])
00118                                                 {
00119                                                         link_vectors[i] = vec;
00120                                                         min_dist[i] = vec.length();
00121                                                         min_index[i] = j;
00122                                                         link_points[i] = m_vertices[j];
00123                                                 }
00124                                         }
00125                                 }
00126                         }
00127 
00128                         // preliminary link_vectors[2]... can point in the opposite direction.
00129                         link_vectors[2] = link_vectors[0].cross(link_vectors[1]);
00130 
00131                         // Establish 3 linearly independent rays from these points
00132                         m_ray_i = new Ray<Type>(m_vertices[0], link_vectors[0]);
00133                         m_ray_j = new Ray<Type>(m_vertices[0], link_vectors[1]);
00134                         m_ray_k = new Ray<Type>(m_vertices[0], link_vectors[2]);
00135 
00136                         // find link_points[2] (so that we can establish k_dim)
00137                         Vec3<Type> closest_vertex;
00138                         double min_ray_dist = DBL_MAX;
00139 
00140                         for (int i = 1; i < 8; i++)
00141                         {
00142                                 if (m_vertices[i] == link_points[0])
00143                                         continue;
00144 
00145                                 if (m_vertices[i] == link_points[1])
00146                                         continue;
00147 
00148                                 // NOTE: Ray::getDistance works in such a way that whether it doesn't matter if
00149                                 // the cross-product vector link_vectors[2] is currently pointing in the wrong direction
00150                                 double dist = m_ray_k->getDistance(m_vertices[i]);
00151 
00152                                 if (dist < min_ray_dist)
00153                                 {
00154                                         min_ray_dist = dist;
00155                                         closest_vertex = m_vertices[i];
00156                                 }
00157                         }
00158 
00159                         link_points[2] = closest_vertex;
00160                         
00161                         // now make sure the link_vectors[2] vector points in the right direction for our ray_k, because voxelize() will
00162                         // depend on that direction being the right one...
00163                         Vec3<Type> vec;
00164                         vec = link_points[2] - m_vertices[0];
00165                         link_vectors[2] = vec;
00166                         
00167                         m_ray_k->setValue(m_ray_k->getOrigin(), link_vectors[2]);
00168 
00169                         // Establish width, height and length, for index calculation
00170                         m_i_dim = (link_points[0] - m_vertices[0]).length();
00171                         m_j_dim = (link_points[1] - m_vertices[0]).length();
00172                         m_k_dim = (link_points[2] - m_vertices[0]).length();
00173 
00174                         m_resolution = resolution;
00175                         m_fill_init = 1;
00176 
00177                         voxelize();
00178                 }
00179 
00180                 int getFillPoint(int index, Vec3<Type> &pt)
00181                 {
00182                         if (m_fill_init == 0)
00183                                 prepareFill(1.0);
00184 
00185                         if (index < 0 || index >= m_num_fill_points)
00186                         {
00187                                 pt.setValue(0.0, 0.0, 0.0);
00188                                 return -1;
00189                         } else {
00190                                 pt = m_fill_points[index];
00191                                 return 0;
00192                         }
00193                 }
00194 
00195         private:
00196                 int m_fill_init;
00197                 double m_resolution;
00198                 
00199                 // 3 linearly independent rays meeting at an arbitrarily chosen corner
00200                 Ray<Type> *m_ray_i;
00201                 Ray<Type> *m_ray_j;
00202                 Ray<Type> *m_ray_k;
00203 
00204                 // Width, height and length
00205                 double m_i_dim;
00206                 double m_j_dim;
00207                 double m_k_dim;
00208 
00209                 std::vector< Vec3<Type> > m_fill_points;
00210                 int m_num_fill_points;
00211 
00212                 // generates the actual discrete fill points in m_fill_points
00213                 void voxelize()
00214                 {
00215                         // traverse the linearly independent rays (local coordinate system) three-dimensionally
00216                         for (double i = 0.0; round_to(i, m_resolution) < m_i_dim; i+=(m_resolution / 2.0))
00217                         {
00218                                 Vec3<Type> ray_j_offset = m_ray_i->getValue(i);
00219 
00220                                 m_ray_j->setValue(ray_j_offset, m_ray_j->getDirection());
00221 
00222                                 for (double j = 0.0; round_to(j, m_resolution) < m_j_dim; j+=(m_resolution / 2.0))
00223                                 {
00224                                         Vec3<Type> ray_k_offset = m_ray_j->getValue(j);
00225 
00226                                         m_ray_k->setValue(ray_k_offset, m_ray_k->getDirection());
00227 
00228                                         for (double k = 0.0; round_to(k, m_resolution) < m_k_dim; k+=(m_resolution / 2.0))
00229                                         {
00230                                                 Vec3<Type> temp;
00231 
00232                                                 temp = m_ray_k->getValue(k);
00233 
00234                                                 // discretize this voxel
00235                                                 temp.x() = round_to(temp.x(), m_resolution);
00236                                                 temp.y() = round_to(temp.y(), m_resolution);
00237                                                 temp.z() = round_to(temp.z(), m_resolution);
00238 
00239                                                 temp.x() /= m_resolution;
00240                                                 temp.y() /= m_resolution;
00241                                                 temp.z() /= m_resolution;
00242 
00243                                                 // add it to our flat list
00244                                                 m_fill_points.push_back(temp);
00245                                         }
00246                                 }
00247                         }
00248 
00249                         // finally, remove duplicate voxels from our flat list...
00250                         remove_duplicates(m_fill_points);
00251                         m_num_fill_points = (int)m_fill_points.size();
00252                 }
00253 
00254                 // this function rounds value to the closest modulus of specified resolution
00255                 int round_to(Type value, Type resolution)
00256                 {
00257                         int low_boundary;
00258                         int high_boundary;
00259                         Type dist_to_low;
00260                         Type dist_to_high;
00261 
00262                         low_boundary = (int)((int)(value / resolution) * resolution);
00263                         high_boundary = low_boundary + (int)((double)resolution + 0.5);
00264 
00265                         dist_to_low = value - (Type)low_boundary;
00266                         dist_to_high = (Type)high_boundary - value;
00267 
00268                         if (dist_to_low < dist_to_high)
00269                         {
00270                                 return low_boundary;
00271                         } else {
00272                                 return high_boundary;
00273                         }
00274                 }
00275 
00276                 static bool sort_operator(Vec3<Type> v1, Vec3<Type> v2)
00277                 {
00278                         if (v1.x() < v2.x())
00279                         {
00280                                 return true;
00281                         } else if (v1.x() > v2.x()) {
00282                                 return false;
00283                         } else {
00284                                 if (v1.y() < v2.y())
00285                                 {
00286                                         return true;
00287                                 } else if (v1.y() > v2.y()) {
00288                                         return false;
00289                                 } else {
00290                                         if (v1.z() < v2.z())
00291                                         {
00292                                                 return true;
00293                                         } else {
00294                                                 return false;
00295                                         }
00296                                 }
00297                         }
00298                 }
00299 
00300                 void remove_duplicates(std::vector< Vec3<Type> > &vec)
00301                 {
00302                         std::sort(vec.begin(), vec.end(), sort_operator);
00303                         vec.erase(std::unique(vec.begin(), vec.end()), vec.end());
00304                 }
00305         };
00306 
00307     typedef RectPrism<int>    RectPrismi;
00308     typedef RectPrism<float>  RectPrismf;
00309     typedef RectPrism<double> RectPrismd;
00310 } // namespace gtl
